agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
agency_address: 2533 N. Carson Street #100 Carson City, Nevada 89706
summary_of_incident: The Division of Child and Family Services received a report that a child was taken to a local hospital after beingfound at the bottom of the community pool. The child was reported to be in critical condition.
cause_of_incident_if_determined: The cause of the child to be in critical condition was related to child drowning at the community pool.

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
agency_address: 2533 N. Carson Street #100 Carson City, Nevada 89706
summary_of_incident: The Division of Child and Family Services received a report that a child was brought to a local hospital as theywere lethargic and was determined by medical professionals to be hypoxic. The child was reported to be inserious condition.

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
summary_of_incident: Local law enforcement responded to family home for unresponsive child. Lifesaving steps were initiatedby local EMS team. Child was transported to local hospital where the child was pronounced dead. Childabuse/neglect were not suspected around the child fatality.

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
summary_of_incident: Child stole a car from an employee where child was residing and was involved in a car accident. Upon emergencymedical personnel arrival, child was alert, but deemed to be in critical condition. Child was transported to anotherhospital, however suffered a medical incident while in transport and died.

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
agency_address: 1010 Ruby Vista Drive, Ste. 101, Elko NV 89801
summary_of_incident: Family traveling through Elko to Reno from Colorado when they pulled over to change the infants diaperand discovered her not breathing.
cause_of_incident_if_determined: Cause of death is pending at this time.

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
agency_address: 2533 N. Carson Street #100 Carson City, Nevada 89706
summary_of_incident: The Division of Child and Family Services received a report that a child was transported to a local hospital as shewas found to be unresponsive and had to be intubated. The child was transported to another hospital for furthertreatment, where she was deemed to be in critical condition/near fatal. While at the hospital, the child receivedmultiple doses of Narcan, which she responded too, and she was found to be positive for opiates.
cause_of_incident_if_determined: The cause of the near fatality is still under investigation.

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
agency_address: 2533 N. Carson Street #100 Carson City, Nevada 89701
summary_of_incident: DCFS received a report requesting immediate response due to child fatality and condition of the home. It wasreported that the child had 2 seizures earlier in the day, was taken to the pediatrician and was sent home withinstructions to take Motrin every 6 hours. A few hours later, the father found the child unresponsive and notbreathing. There is a concern that there was a delay in contacting 911. The child was taken to the hospital andpronounced deceased.

agency_address: 2533 N Carson St. Suite 100 Carson City NV 89706
summary_of_incident: DCFS received a report regarding a child fatality. Emergency medical personnel responded to a 9-1-1 callregarding an unresponsive 12-year-old child. Life saving efforts were unsuccessful, and the child was pronounceddeceased.
location_of_child_at_time_of_incident: Home 225 Pine Lane Carson City NV 89706

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
summary_of_incident: DCFS received a report regarding a child fatality. Emergency medical personnel responded to a 9-1-1 callregarding an unresponsive 7-month-old child after being left in a bathtub. Life saving efforts were unsuccessful,and the child was pronounced dead. While Law Enforcement was in the home, it was observed to be unsafe forchildren.
cause_of_incident_if_determined: Drowning.10/12/2021 information: Autopsy and criminal investigation are still pending.

agency_name: Division of Child & Family Services, Child Welfare
summary_of_incident: Mother found infant unresponsive and gray, with no vital signs. Mother called 911. Emergency medicaltechnicians & law enforcement arrived at the home. EMT did CPR, infant resuscitated, taken to localhospital, then the infant was care flighted to outside area hospital.

agency_name: Division of Child and Family Services
summary_of_incident: The child presented to a local hospital and was deemed in critical condition. Child was care flighted to a largerhospital for ongoing treatment and assessment. Initial assessments indicate child may have suffered nonaccidental trauma and has a poor prognosis.
cause_of_incident_if_determined: Unknown the cause of the near fatality is under investigation.
date_child_suffered_incident: The date when the infant was hurt is unknown.
date_of_notification_to_welfare_agency_o: DCFS was notified of near fatality on January 8, 2021
location_of_child_at_time_of_incident: This incident either occurred in Mineral or Churchill County, Nevada
